could be done under the GNU licence I think.  Or at least something
similar.  Basically allowing people to download it and improve on it but
never sell it and only destribute it with the license in tact.  There's
some other things about it but I haven't read it in a while.  I think
the folks at FSGames would probably rather see the game finished than
not, so if they aren't really going to finish it, as seems to be the
case (but maybe I'm wrong) maybe they wouldn't feel to bad about letting
the comunity take a crack at it.  One thing that's too bad though is I
think most open source stuff is written for the gnu compiler which is
also free and comes with any linux distribution.  But since this is a
windows game the code is for a commercial compiler I'm sure, which would
limit the group of people that could work on it to who has, or can
afford the compiler(or who can warez it. . )

Seth Mitchell wrote:
> 
> I'm still around, though I'm not from FS Games.  Unfortunately, for about 10
> weeks, starting May 30, I'll be in Great Lakes, Illinois learning about
> attention to detail and how to wake up at the crack of dawn.  Go Navy!
> 
> Releasing the source code would be neat, although I don't know how Tom would
> feel about that, nor do I know about the legal issues associated with that,
> if any.
